Description: Book of the Dead of Nebseny; frame 4. At top: spell 144/146; 148. Below: spell 99b continued; spell 62; spell 105; spell 105; spell 30b; spell 30a.
Production date: 15thC BC (reign of Thutmose IV, by style)
Curator's comments: Published: G. Lapp, The Papyrus of Nebseni (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead in the British Museum 3, 2004). For bibliography and date see Irmtraut Munro, Untersuchungen zu den Totenbuch-Papyri der 18.ten Dynastie (London & New York 1987), 281, Katalog, a., 28; the manuscript is Aa in Naville, Tb.
Tarasenko, Mykola. 2016. Studies on the vignettes from chapter 17 of the Book of the Dead. I, The image of mś.w Bdšt in ancient Egyptian mythology (Archaeopress Egyptology 16), Oxford, p. 92-93, 99.
Bibliographic references: Munro 1987 / Untersuchungen zu den Totenbuch-Papyri der 18. Dynastie (281)
Taylor 2010 / Journey through the afterlife: Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead (no. 103)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134286) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134286)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006-2007 6 Oct-18 Feb, Tokyo, National Museum of Nature and Science, Mummy: The Inside Story 2007 17 Mar-17 Jun, Kobe City Museum, Mummy: The Inside Story 2012 July – September, Tokyo, Mori museum, The Book of the Dead: Journey Through the Afterlife 2012, October - November, Fukuoka Museum of Art, The Book of the Dead 2013, Apr - Jul, Paris, Louvre, L'Art Du Contour 2013/2014, Sept - Jan, Musée royaux d’art et d’histoire, Brussels, L'Art Du Contour
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss Black ink Red ink Checked for loan to Japan 2006 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: Filmoplast T self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good (but fragmentary near start and sporadic lacunae)
